diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Neurofibromatosis type 1, Lynch syndrome, Fanconi’s anemia, Peutz–Jeghers syndrome, Cowden syndrome, Carney complex
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of CMMR-D syndrome was confirmed by immunohistochemical analysis showing a complete absence of PMS2 in both the tumor and normal tissue, indicative of a constitutional absence of PMS2 protein. Genetic testing identified biallelic mutations in PMS2, confirming the diagnosis of CMMR-D syndrome.
